title: 29.1 Standard and Slack Forms
content:
Section 29.1

Standard and Slack Forms

Summary

Canonical forms for representing linear programs.

Key Points

  • LP: maximize cᵀx subject to Ax ≤ b, x ≥ 0
  • Standard form: all constraints are ≤, all variables ≥ 0
  • Slack form: Ax = b with slack variables, x ≥ 0
  • Any LP can be converted to these forms
  • Basic solution: set n-m variables to 0, solve for others

Example

Maximize 2x₁ + 3x₂ subject to x₁ + x₂ ≤ 4, x₁ ≤ 2, x₂ ≤ 3. Add slack: x₁ + x₂ + s₁ = 4, etc.

Why It Matters

Standard forms enable systematic solution methods.
